name: Pine Nut Candy

instructions.action: Line a baking tray with parchment paper and lightly grease
Lightly toast pine nuts in a dry pan over medium heat for 3-4 minutes until fragrant, set aside
In a heavy-bottomed saucepan, combine sugar, honey, butter, and water
Cook over medium heat, stirring until sugar dissolves
Stop stirring and let mixture boil until it reaches hard crack stage (150°C/300°F)
Remove from heat, add vanilla and salt, stir quickly
Immediately fold in toasted pine nuts and sesame seeds
Pour onto prepared tray and spread to desired thickness
Let cool for 10 minutes, then score into pieces while still warm
Once completely cool and hardened, break along scored lines

tips: Use a candy thermometer for best results
Don't stir after sugar dissolves to prevent crystallization
Work quickly once mixture reaches temperature
Store in airtight container with parchment between layers
Keeps for up to 2 weeks in cool, dry place
Can add a pinch of cardamom for Middle Eastern twist
